title: The US military’s spaceplane is about to fly again—it needs a bigger rocket
content:
CAPE CANAVERAL, Florida—A SpaceX Falcon Heavy rocket is counting down to liftoff Monday night from the Kennedy Space Center in Florida, and the US military's mysterious X-37B spaceplane is fastened atop the heavy-lifter for a ride into orbit.

Although the Space Force is keeping details about the military spaceplane's flight under wraps, we know it's heading into an unusual orbit, probably significantly higher than the X-37B's previous sojourns that stayed within a few hundred miles of Earth's surface.

SpaceX's launch team will load about 3 million pounds of kerosene and liquid oxygen propellants into the Falcon Heavy on Monday evening. Liftoff is set for 8:14 pm ET (01:14 UTC), when 27 engines will roar to life and power the rocket off its launch pad overlooking the Atlantic coastline.
